results.title: Oil painting for beginners with artist Val Osborn. Number 1
results.creator_credit: Leigh Kidd, Robert Dunn, Val Osborn and Coral Coast Video
results.brief_description: In this, the first of three videos, the Australian artist and teacher, Val Osborn, gives a step-by step guide to basic oil-painting techniques. Beginning with a brief history of Australian art from the time of the first settlers, to illustrate the special requirements of painting the Australian landscape, he then gives an introduction to the tools of the artist. Finally he demonstrates two exercises in creating three dimensions on a flat surface, a white billiard ball on a white background and a red apple, showing how to create highlights, mid-tones, shadow and drop shadow.

results.title: Oil in your life
results.brief_description: Produced for the multi-national Atlantics Union Oil Company, as a film for schools, the film traces the use of petroleum products and their place in contemporary life. Illustrates the history of oil; formation in the earth’s crust; the search for oil (drilling); research facilities maintained by the oil industry; handling of oil products at Australian ports and terminals.

results.title: Oil in Pakistan
results.creator_credit: Sydney Samuelson, Anthony Gilkison and Rayant Pictures
results.brief_description: The search for oil in Pakistan. Shows the difficulties encountered, the complicated processes involved in an oil survey, and the discovery of the large reservoir of natural gas at Sui.

results.title: Oil in Libya
results.brief_description: Studies the oil industry and market in Tripoli, Libya. Includes the process of oil-drilling to the final loading of oil on tankers for transportation to foreign markets.

results.title: Oil harbour: Aden
results.brief_description: The construction of the oil harbour at Little Aden built to work in conjunction with the nearby refinery. A large area of land was reclaimed from the sea, and a breakwater and four large jetties were built for this project within a very short contract period. Diagram sequences help to explain the plan and progress of the operation.

results.title: Oil from coal
results.brief_description: The extraction of oil from coal is one of the alternatives being explored by Australian scientists. They are trying to bring this into practical reality by improving the technology. One process being considered is flash pyrolysis. The film looks at this.

results.title: Oil for the 20th century
results.creator_credit: Jack Howells and Jack Howells Productions
results.brief_description: Fifty years ago William Knox D’Arcy obtained a concession to search for oil in Persia. This film records his early difficulties and describes the immense oil-producing organisation which has resulted from his enterprise.
results.description: Fifty years ago William Knox D’Arcy obtained a concession to search for oil in Persia. This film records his early difficulties and describes the immense oil-producing organisation which has resulted from his enterprise.

results.title: Oh! What a night
results.creator_credit: Mack Sennett, Keystone Film Company and W H Productions
results.brief_description: Charlie and Fatty, both well-dressed but very drunk, come home to their long-suffering wives in facing apartments in the same hotel. The women remonstrate so the men go off out again together to a restaurant where they create total chaos and mayhem and are finally ejected from the premises. They then stumble across a row boat in the park and climb in to try and get some sleep - as the film ends we see a sinking boat full of water! Cast: Charlie Chaplin, Fatty Arbuckle, Phyllis Allen and Minta Durfee

results.title: Oh sure
results.creator_credit: Richard Condie, Jerry Krepakevich, Michael Scott and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The subject of this film is unmistakable: how to make a fool of oneself easily and effectively. Two men are involved: one who wishes to read his newspaper and another who insists on performing acrobatic feats. Although the outcome is surprising, the message is clear; the film points out the futility of going to great lengths to impress one’s neighbor.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Condie, Jerry Krepakevich, Michael Scott and ONF | NFB

results.title: Oh No! It's the Franciscus Henri video
results.creator_credit: Graham Slattery, Rob Pemberton, Trish Foremen and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Franciscus Henri has entertained children for many years with his wacky and original songs. After all, a man with a zoo in his house, wearing purple polka-dotted pyjamas, an octopus on his head and who can make unusual pancakes is not to be missed! Stroll with Franciscus Henri through the Milky Way and have lots of fun!
